Test data setup

{% raw %} 
import icedata
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
data_dir = icedata.fridge.load_data()
class_map = icedata.fridge.class_map()
parser = icedata.fridge.parser(data_dir, class_map)
train_records, valid_records = parser.parse()

INFO     - Autofixing records | icevision.parsers.parser:parse:126

Code 







    {% raw %}
    















convert_rgb_image_to_bokeh_rgb_image[source]
convert_rgb_image_to_bokeh_rgb_image(img:ndarray)




Convertes a image in the form of a numpy array to an array that can be shown by bokeh.















    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    





    {% endraw %}






Bokeh requries images to be in a hw format where each value is a 32bit integer where each of the 8bit sequences contains the rgb and alpha values.








    {% raw %}
    















draw_record_with_bokeh[source]
draw_record_with_bokeh(record, class_map=None, display_label=True, display_bbox=False, display_mask=False, display_keypoints=False, return_figure=False)




Draws a record or returns a bokeh figure containing the image.















    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    





    {% endraw %}






Wrapper around the draw_record function from icevision.








    {% raw %}
    















aggregate_record_data[source]
aggregate_record_data(records)




Aggregates stats from a list of records and returns a pandas dataframe with the aggregated stats.















    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    





    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    







    


res = pd.DataFrame(aggregate_record_data(valid_records))

draw_class_based_barplot[source]
draw_class_based_barplot(counts, values, class_map=None, bar_type='horizontal', width=500, height=500)




Creates a figure with a histogram.















    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    





    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    







    


%%capture --no-stderr
# test draw_histogram without a classmap
p = draw_class_based_barplot([10, 20], [1,2])
pn.Row(p)



    








    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    







    


%%capture --no-stderr
# test draw_histogram without a classmap
hist = [[1, 10], [2, 20]]
cls_map = ClassMap(["a", "b"])
p = draw_class_based_barplot([10, 20], [1, 2], cls_map, bar_type="vertical")
pn.Row(p)



    








    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    















histogram[source]
histogram(values, bins=10, range=None, density=False, plot_figure=None, width=500, height=500)




Creates a histogram















    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    





    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    







    


%%capture --no-stderr
pn.Row(histogram([1,1,1,1,2,2,2,3,3,4], bins=4, range=(1,4), density=True))



    








    {% endraw %}

    {% raw %}
    







    


%%capture --no-stderr
p = figure(title="Test")
p = histogram([1,1,1,1,2,2,2,3,3,4], bins=4, plot_figure=p)
pn.Row(p)
